igt.tag-types: L B B B B B M M M M M M M M M B G T

tier.item: b. m hak m th nt saw-j -y
A further type not discussed here are languages in which all adjectives can enter a predicative construction with
a copula and a different predicative construction without; this can be found in Dravidian languages like Telugu
There are some minor differences bet ween "adjectival" and "verbal" verbs, but they do not exceed the amount
of variation that one would expect to find within a part of speech anywa ys.
The affix glossed as NOM does only appear if the subject is the controller of the action.
b. m hak m th nt saw-j -y
